page.title: 10Kidderminster, Rifle Range
page.content: The area known as the Rifle Range was, as the name suggests, once used as a wartime artillery range. It is bordered on the north by the A456, the main road between the Midlands and Central Wales, the West Midlands Safari Park to the west and the Severn Valley Railway to the south. The east side is an escarpment, on the top of which stands Birchen Coppice Schools. The Rifle Range is now an area of outstanding natural beauty, administered by the Worcestershier Conservation Trust. It is one of the few remaining regions of dry, lowland heath left in the Midlands. Prominent in the middle is the Devil's Spittleful or Spadeful, a sandstone outcrop.
